abstract: A set of 3D objects that the framework attempts to detect in the user’s environment.
overview:
## Discussion

Use this property to choose known 3D objects for ARKit to find in the user’s environment and present as [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARObjectAnchor] for use in your AR experience.

To create reference objects for detection, scan them in a world-tracking session and use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldMap] to extract [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARReferenceObject] instances. You can then save reference objects as files and package them in any ARKit app you create using an Xcode asset catalog.

# detectionObjects

**Instance Property**

A set of 3D objects that the framework attempts to detect in the user’s environment.

## Declaration

```swift
var detectionObjects: Set<ARReferenceObject> { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to choose known 3D objects for ARKit to find in the user’s environment and present as [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARObjectAnchor] for use in your AR experience.

To create reference objects for detection, scan them in a world-tracking session and use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldMap] to extract [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARReferenceObject] instances. You can then save reference objects as files and package them in any ARKit app you create using an Xcode asset catalog.
title: detectionObjects
